The '''''Atanatárion''''' was a literary work dealing with the three "Great Tales" as written down in [[Númenor]] that were primarily concerned with the heroes of the [[Edain]] of the late [[First Age]].<ref name=Atan/>

These three Great Tales, which were later preserved in [[Gondor]], were:<ref name=Atan>{{MR|P5I}}, p. 373</ref>

1) '''''[[Lay of Leithian|Narn Beren ion Barahir]]''''' ("Tale of [[Beren]] son of [[Barahir]]") or '''''Narn e·Dinúviel''''' ("Tale of the [[Lúthien|Nightingale]]")

2) ''Narn e·mbar [[Hador]]'' ("Tale of the [[House of Hador]]"), which consists of:

* a) '''''[[Narn i Chîn Húrin (tale)|Narn i·Chîn Húrin]]''''' ("Tale of the Children of [[Húrin]]") or '''''Narn e·’Rach [[Morgoth]]''''' ("Tale of the Curse of Morgoth")

* b) '''''Narn en·Êl''''' ("Tale of the [[Eärendil|Star]]") or '''''Narn e·Dant [[Gondolin]] ar Orthad en·Êl''''' ("Tale of the [[Fall of Gondolin]] and the Raising of the [[Star of Eärendil|Star]]")

== Etymology ==
The title ''Atanatárion'' is [[Quenya]] for "([[Legendarium]]) of the [[Atanatári|Fathers of Men]]", with the later part of the title forming a genitive plural of the term ''Atanatar'' ("of the Fathers of Men"), while the "Legendarium" part of the title is implied in the English gloss of the title of the work.<ref name=Eldamo>{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-2087321675.html|articlename=Q. ''Atanatárion'' pn.|website=Eldamo|accessed=22 November 2023}}</ref>

The [[Sindarin]] cognates of the title are '''''Nern in Adanath''''' and '''''Nern in Edenedair''''', where the "Legendarium" part of the title is explicitly translated,<ref name=Eldamo/> with the term ''Nern'' being the plural of the noun ''[[narn (noun)|narn]]'' ("a tale").<ref>{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-1452341695.html|articlename=S. ''narn'' n.|website=Eldamo|accessed=22 November 2023}}</ref>

== Composition ==
[[Tolkien]] wrote about the ''Atanatárion'' and the titles of the three Great Tales on a small slip with the heading: ''Memorandum'', some time in the [[1950]]'s. According to [[Christopher Tolkien]], he probably considered composing them in the form of three shorter stories as Appendices to ''[[The Silmarillion]]''.<ref name=Atan/>
